verses.kjv: Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;
verses.ct: Now, brothers and sisters, I want to remind you of the good news that I shared with you — the message you accepted and on which you have taken your stand.

verses.kjv: By which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain.
verses.ct: This is the message through which you are saved, if you hold firmly to what I told you. Otherwise, your belief was for nothing.

verses.kjv: For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures;
verses.ct: What I passed on to you as most important was what I myself had received: that Christ died for our sins, just as the scriptures said he would,

verses.kjv: And that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures:
verses.ct: that he was buried, and that he was raised on the 3rd day, again just as the scriptures said.

verses.kjv: And that he was seen of Cephas, then of the twelve:
verses.ct: He appeared to Cephas, and then to the 12.

verses.kjv: After that, he was seen of above five hundred brethren at once; of whom the greater part remain unto this present, but some are fallen asleep.
verses.ct: After that, he appeared to more than 500 brothers and sisters at the same time. Most of them are still alive today, though some have died.

verses.kjv: After that, he was seen of James; then of all the apostles.
verses.ct: Then he appeared to James, and later to all the apostles.

verses.kjv: And last of all he was seen of me also, as of one born out of due time.
verses.ct: Finally, last of all, he appeared to me as well — like someone born at the wrong time.

verses.kjv: For I am the least of the apostles, that am not meet to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.
verses.ct: I am the least important of the apostles, and I don't even deserve to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

verses.kjv: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and his grace which was bestowed upon me was not in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
verses.ct: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace toward me was not wasted. I worked harder than all of them — yet it wasn't really me doing it, but the grace of God working through me.

verses.kjv: Therefore whether it were I or they, so we preach, and so ye believed.
verses.ct: So whether it was me or them, this is what we all proclaim, and this is what you believed.

verses.kjv: Now if Christ be preached that he rose from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?
verses.ct: If we are proclaiming that Christ has been raised from the dead, how can some of you claim that there is no resurrection of the dead?

verses.kjv: But if there be no resurrection of the dead, then is Christ not risen:
verses.ct: If there is no resurrection of the dead, then not even Christ has been raised.

verses.kjv: And if Christ be not risen, then is our preaching vain, and your faith is also vain.
verses.ct: And if Christ has not been raised, then our preaching is worthless, and your faith is worthless too.

verses.kjv: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God; because we have testified of God that he raised up Christ: whom he raised not up, if so be that the dead rise not.
verses.ct: On top of that, we would be guilty of lying about God, because we testified that God raised Christ — which he did not do, if it's true that the dead are not raised.

verses.kjv: For if the dead rise not, then is not Christ raised:
verses.ct: Because if the dead are not raised, then Christ has not been raised either.

verses.kjv: And if Christ be not raised, your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sins.
verses.ct: And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is pointless — you are still trapped in your sins.

verses.kjv: Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.
verses.ct: It would also mean that those who died believing in Christ are lost forever.

verses.kjv: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.
verses.ct: If our hope in Christ applies only to this present life, we are the most pitiful people on earth.

verses.kjv: But now is Christ risen from the dead, and become the firstfruits of them that slept.
verses.ct: But the truth is, Christ has been raised from the dead — the first of a great harvest among those who have died.

verses.kjv: For since by man came death, by man came also the resurrection of the dead.
verses.ct: Since death came through one man, the resurrection of the dead also comes through one man.

verses.kjv: For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive.
verses.ct: Just as everyone dies because of Adam, so everyone will be brought to life through Christ.

verses.kjv: But every man in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward they that are Christ’s at his coming.
verses.ct: But each in the proper sequence: Christ first, as the initial harvest; then, when he returns, those who belong to him.

verses.kjv: Then cometh the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he shall have put down all rule and all authority and power.
verses.ct: After that comes the end, when he hands over the kingdom to God the Father, after he has abolished every ruler, every authority, and every power.

verses.kjv: For he must reign, till he hath put all enemies under his feet.
verses.ct: For Christ must rule until he has placed every enemy beneath his feet.

verses.kjv: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.
verses.ct: The final enemy to be abolished is death.

verses.kjv: For he hath put all things under his feet. But when he saith all things are put under him, it is manifest that he is excepted, which did put all things under him.
verses.ct: For God has placed everything beneath his feet. Of course, when it says "everything" has been placed under him, it's obvious that God himself — the one who put everything under Christ — is not included in that.

verses.kjv: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then shall the Son also himself be subject unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all.
verses.ct: Once everything has been brought under Christ's authority, then the Son himself will submit to the one who placed everything under him, so that God will be supreme over all.

verses.kjv: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?
verses.ct: Otherwise, what will those people do who are being baptized on behalf of the dead? If the dead are truly never raised, why are people being baptized for them?

verses.kjv: And why stand we in jeopardy every hour?
verses.ct: And why would we put ourselves in danger every single hour?

verses.kjv: I protest by your rejoicing which I have in Christ Jesus our LORD, I die daily.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, I face death every day — I swear it by the pride I have in you through Christ Jesus our LORD.

verses.kjv: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not? let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.
verses.ct: If I fought wild animals in Ephesus for merely human reasons, what did I gain from it? If the dead are not raised, then "let's just eat and drink, because tomorrow we die."

verses.kjv: Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.
verses.ct: Don't be fooled: bad company ruins good character.

verses.kjv: Awake to righteousness, and sin not; for some have not the knowledge of God: I speak this to your shame.
verses.ct: Come to your senses and stop sinning. Some of you have no real knowledge of God — I say this to shame you.

verses.kjv: But some man will say, How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?
verses.ct: But someone might ask, "How exactly are the dead raised? What kind of body will they have?"

verses.kjv: Thou fool, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die:
verses.ct: What a foolish question! When you plant a seed, it doesn't sprout to life unless it first dies.

verses.kjv: And that which thou sowest, thou sowest not that body that shall be, but bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some other grain:
verses.ct: When you plant something, you don't put the finished plant in the ground — you plant a bare seed, maybe wheat or something else.

verses.kjv: But God giveth it a body as it hath pleased him, and to every seed his own body.
verses.ct: But God gives it whatever body he chooses, and he gives each kind of seed its own distinct body.

verses.kjv: All flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fishes, and another of birds.
verses.ct: Not all flesh is the same. Humans have one kind, animals have another, fish have another, and birds have yet another.

verses.kjv: There are also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.
verses.ct: There are heavenly bodies and there are earthly bodies, but the glory of the heavenly is different from the glory of the earthly.

verses.kjv: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars: for one star differeth from another star in glory.
verses.ct: The sun has its own glory, the moon has a different glory, and the stars have still another glory. Even among the stars, each one differs from the others in glory.

verses.kjv: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption:
verses.ct: That's how it is with the resurrection of the dead. The body that is buried is perishable; the body that is raised is imperishable.

verses.kjv: It is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:
verses.ct: It is buried in disgrace; it is raised in glory. It is buried in weakness; it is raised in power.

verses.kjv: It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.
verses.ct: What is buried is a natural body; what is raised is a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.

verses.kjv: And so it is written, The first man Adam was made a living soul; the last Adam was made a quickening spirit.
verses.ct: As scripture says, "The first man, Adam, was made a living soul." The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.

verses.kjv: Howbeit that was not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; and afterward that which is spiritual.
verses.ct: The spiritual did not come first — the natural came first, and then the spiritual.

verses.kjv: The first man is of the earth, earthy: the second man is the Lord from heaven.
verses.ct: The first man was from the earth, made of dust. The second man is the Lord from heaven.

verses.kjv: As is the earthy, such are they also that are earthy: and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.
verses.ct: Those who are made of dust are like the man of dust, and those who belong to heaven are like the man from heaven.

verses.kjv: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.
verses.ct: Just as we have carried the likeness of the man made from dust, we will also carry the likeness of the man from heaven.

verses.kjv: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.
verses.ct: Here is what I'm telling you, brothers and sisters: flesh and blood cannot share in the kingdom of God, and what is perishable cannot share in what is imperishable.

verses.kjv: Behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,
verses.ct: Pay attention — I'm revealing a mystery to you: Not all of us will die, but every one of us will be transformed,

verses.kjv: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.
verses.ct: in an instant, in the blink of an eye, at the sound of the final trumpet. The trumpet will blast, and the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be transformed.

verses.kjv: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.
verses.ct: For this perishable body must be clothed with the imperishable, and this mortal body must be clothed with immortality.

verses.kjv: So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.
verses.ct: When the perishable has been clothed with the imperishable, and the mortal has been clothed with immortality, then the written prophecy will come true: "Death has been swallowed up in victory."

verses.kjv: O death, where is thy sting? O grave, where is thy victory?
verses.ct: "Death, where is your sting? Grave, where is your victory?"

verses.kjv: The sting of death is sin; and the strength of sin is the law.
verses.ct: The sting that gives death its power is sin, and the thing that gives sin its power is the law.

verses.kjv: But thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: But thank God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ!

verses.kjv: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.
verses.ct: So then, my dear brothers and sisters, stand firm and don't let anything shake you. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that nothing you do for the Lord is ever wasted.
